text: Quintet (stylized as QUINTET) is a 5 on 5 winner stays on Japanese grappling promotion created by MMA legend Kazushi Sakuraba. Quintet is broadcast on UFC Fight Pass. Sakuraba had been developing the format with friend and former UFC champion Josh Barnett and, while in Las Vegas to be inducted to the UFC's Hall of Fame in July 2017, 'Saku' took the chance to pitch the concept to UFC executive Ant Evans. Evans, the content officer for UFC Fight Pass, loved the idea and helped the Japanese team tweak the concept before ultimately signing Quintet to a long-term deal with UFC Fight Pass.https://twitter.com/AntEvansMMA/status/1042862420417372160?s=20 ==Rules== ===Fight Mat=== 12ｍｘ12m square wrestling mat. No line boundaries. In case of obvious risk of falling out of the mat area, the referee stops the bout and the bout is restarted in a safe area in the same position. ===Winner Stays on System=== Winner fights to the next fighter from the opposing team. Draw means both fighters are out. If the last fighter loses, the team loses. In the case that both teams are down to their last fighters with the match results in a draw, the winning team is then determined by whichever has the fewest cumulative penalties throughout all the matches. ===Weight=== Total weight of the team (five fighters) must be: Regular Weight Class: under 430 kg one day prior to the event. Light Weight Class: under 360 kg one day prior to the event. ===Time Limits=== Usually it is 1X8min round & 1X4min round (Regular Weight Class: in case of 20 kg+ weight difference Light Weight Class: in cases of 10 kg+ weight difference) ==List of Winners== {| class="wikitable" |- !Weight Class!!Winner!!Runner-up!!Event!!Date!!Tournament Bracket |- | Openweight || Polaris || HALEO || Quintet 1 || April 11, 2018 || Quintet 1 Bracket |- | Lightweight || Carpe Diem|| HALEO|| Quintet Fight Night 1 || June 9, 2018 || Quintet Fight Night 1 Bracket |- | Openweight || 10th Planet || Reebok || Quintet 2 || July 16, 2018 || Quintet 2 Bracket |- | Openweight || Alpha Male || Polaris || Quintet 3 || October 5, 2018 || Quintet 3 Bracket |- |} ==List of events== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:90%; text-align: center;" | Notes |- |Bantamweight 66 kg | Nicky Ryan |def. | Hideo Tokoro |Submission (Rear-Naked Choke) |align=center| |align=center| | |- |Light Heavyweight 93 kg | Marcelo Nunes |def. | Haisam Rida |Submission (Arm-Triangle Choke) |align=center| |align=center| | |- |Heavyweight 120 kg | Satoshi Ishii |def. | Frank Mir |DQ (Stalling) |align=center| |align=center| | |} ===Quintet 3 Bracket=== ==Quintet Fight Night 2== Quintet Fight Night 2 was a grappling team survival event held by Quintet on February 3, 2019 at the Arena Tachikawa Tachihi in Tokyo, Japan. ===Teams=== {| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| |} ==Quintet Fight Night 3== Quintet Fight Night 3 was a grappling team survival event held by Quintet on April 7, 2019 at the Arena Tachikawa Tachihi in Tokyo, Japan. It was the first Quintet event to feature women's grappling. ===Teams=== {| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| BJJ kunoichi Team * Rikako Yuasa * Iori Echigo * Nanami Ichikawa * Yuki Sugiuchi * Akiko Sawada | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| Sun Chlorella Team * Miyuu Yamamoto * Sara McMann * Mika Nagano * Megumi Sugimoto * Miyuu Ikemoto | style="vertical- align:top; width:18%;"| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:15%;"| DEEP Jewels Team * Tomo Maesawa * Emi Tomimatsu * Reina Miura * Yukari Nabe * Hikaru Aono | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| 10th Planet Team * Lila Smadja-Cruz * Fabiana Jorge * Liz Carmouche * Grace Gundrum * Elvira Karppinen | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| |} ==Quintet Fight Night 4== Quintet Fight Night 4 was a grappling team survival event held by Quintet on November 30, 2019 at the Akita city cultural center in Tokyo, Japan. ===Teams=== {| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| Team Paraestra * Kohei Yasumi * Ayumu Shioda * Yutaka Saito * Yusuke Honma * Shoki Higuchi | style="vertical- align:top; width:18%;"| Team K-Top BJJ * Inseong Jang * Wanki Chae * Gyeongseop Lee * Youngseung Cho * Jun Yong Cho | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:15%;"| Team Sakuraba * Daisuke Nakamura * Yuji Hoshino * Shutaro Debana * Kazuhiro Suzuki * Yoichi Fukumoto | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| Team Carpe Diem * Masahiro Iwasaki * Tomoshige Sera * Sotaro Yamada * Yukinari Tamura * Tomoyuki Hashimoto | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| |} ==Quintet Ultra== Quintet Ultra was a grappling team survival event held by Quintet on December 12, 2019 at the Red Rock Casino in Las Vegas, USA. This event was based around teams representing four of the most notable MMA promotions: the UFC, Pride Fighting Championships, Strikeforce and World Extreme Cagefighting. Combatants were chosen based on how closely linked their careers were to those promotions. ===Teams=== {| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| Team UFC * Anthony Smith * Anthony Johnson * Sean O'Malley * Clay Guida * Gilbert Burns | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| Team Pride FC * Kazushi Sakuraba * Takanori Gomi * Gregor Gracie * Héctor Lombard * Yves Edwards | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| |- | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| Team Strikeforce * Gilbert Melendez * Jake Shields * Muhammed Lawal * Gesias Cavalcante * Renato Sobral | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| Team WEC * Chad Mendes * Glover Teixeira * Mark Muñoz * Cub Swanson * James Krause | style="vertical-align:top; width:18%;"| |} ===Quintet Ultra bracket=== ===Super Matches=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 80%;" |- ! colspan="8" style="background-color: #ccf; color: #000080; text- align: center;" | Quintet Ultra |- ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | Weight Class ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | Method ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | Round ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | Time ! colspan="1" style="background-color: #E6E8FA; color: #000000; text-align: center;" | Notes |- |Heavyweight 120 kg | Gordon Ryan |def. | Aleksei Oleinik |Submission (kneebar) |align=center| |align=center| | |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Grappling competitions Category:2018 establishments in Japan Category:Sports leagues established in 2018
